content.description:
THE IMPACT OF THIRD-PARTY CANDIDATES ON KEY SWING STATES IN THE 2016 ELECTION

Source: The Associated Press and the Wall Street Journal, 2016.
content.question: Based on the data in the chart and your knowledge of presidential elections, which of the following is the best strategy that Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump could have used to pull votes away from the third-party candidates, Jill Stein and Gary Johnson?

choices.label: Trump or Clinton could have promised to work with members of third parties in Congress if elected.
Trump or Clinton could have agreed to appoint Stein or Johnson to Cabinet positions after the election.
Trump or Clinton could have adopted issues that were popular with Stein’s and Johnson’s voters in Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin as part of their campaigns.
Trump and Clinton could have agreed to include Stein and Johnson in presidential debates to show that they were open to discussing issue important to third parties.

content.answer: Trump or Clinton could have adopted issues that were popular with Stein’s and Johnson’s voters in Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin as part of their campaigns.
